definitions.definition: a person whose job is designing buildings

examples.text: The house was designed by architect Louis Kahn.
She's a London-based architect and interior designer.
In 1721 he was named **chief architect** of the cathedral.

definitions.definition: a person who is responsible for planning or creating an idea, an event or a situation

examples.text: He was one of the principal architects of the revolution.
Jones was the architect of the team's first goal.

definitions.definition: a person who designs or puts together a program or computer system

examples.text: We are looking for an IT data architect to work within our Systems Architecture team.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from French architecte, from Italian architetto, via Latin from Greek arkhitektōn, from arkhi- ‘chief’ + tektōn ‘builder’.
